brief_description: To study the immune response to vaccinia vaccine in immunosuppressed Rhesus macaques and to develop a relevant preclinical model in which the efficacy and safety of vaccines in the setting of transplantation can be evaluated.
brief_title: Responses to and control of vaccinia in immunosuppressed Rhesus Macaques
condition_studied: Assessment of Modified Vaccinia Ankara and Vaccinia vaccine responses in Rhesus Macaques receiving CNI-based or sirolimus-based immunosuppressive regimens without renal allografts.
description: A detailed mechanistic study of the immune response to vaccinia vaccine in immunosuppressed Rhesus macaques and development of a relevant preclinical model in which the efficacy and safety of vaccines in the setting of transplantation can be evaluated.
endpoints:
1. PCR monitoring of viral load.
  2. FCM experiment to measure frequency and phenotypic profile of T cell subsets in rhesus macaques.
  3. ELISPOT assay to assess memory B cell function in rhesus macaques with tacrolimus and sirolimus treatment.
  4. ELISA serum antibody titers to assess memory B cell function in rhesus macaques with tacrolimus and sirolimus treatment.
  5. FCM experiment to study effects of vaccination on renal allograft in rhesus macaques.
  6. ELISPOT experiment to study effects of vaccination on renal allograft in rhesus macaques.
  7. Microarray gene expression analysis.
intervention_agent: CNI-based or sirolimus-based immunosuppressants, Modified Vaccinia Ankara and Vaccinia vaccines.
objectives:
1. Describe Rhesus cellular response to VV and map epitopes in MHC-typed macaques.
  2. To compare the magnitude and character of immune responses (T and B cell responses and molecular signature) after immunization with the MVA in macaques receiving CNI or sirolimus-based immunosuppressive regimens relative to untreated controls.
  3. To determine whether prior immunization with replication deficient MVA enhances the response to and improves viral control after VV challenge in immunosuppressed macaques.
official_title: Responses to and control of vaccinia in immunosuppressed Rhesus Macaques
